title: If no webapps deployed, accessing a URL returns 200 OK with no content instead of 404
description: When starting a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed and accessing a URL, it should return an HTTP error 404 instead of a 200 OK response with no content.
OB: If I start a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps on it and access a URL, it returns HTTP code 200 OK with no content, instead of an HTTP error 404.
EB: When I start a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed and access a URL, it should return an HTTP error 404, indicating that the requested resource is not found.
SR:
1. Download the Tomcat 7 instance from http://mirror.veriportal.com/apache/tomcat/tomcat7/v7.0.0beta/bin/apachetomcat7.0.0.zip
2. Start the Tomcat instance without deploying any webapps
3. Access a URL in the Tomcat instance
4. Verify that the response is an HTTP error 404, indicating that the requested resource is not found.
